dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That viral WhatsApp message is just, uh, it's just completely false.

dialogue_turns.text: Right, the one claiming a 40 to 50 degree heatwave across like, all of Europe and Central Asia?

dialogue_turns.text: Which is good, because people were really sharing that thing everywhere. It said this happens only once every 60 years.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it named all these countries—Kazakhstan, Russia, Ukraine, Belarus. It sounded so specific, which made it seem believable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it named all these countries-Kazakhstan, Russia, Ukraine, Belarus. It sounded so specific, which made it seem believable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The message claims such weather occurs only once every 60 years and will affect Kazakhstan, Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus.

dialogue_turns.text: Well, he did say some parts of the southwest could potentially get up to 45, which is seriously hot, but that's not the whole-country catastrophe the rumor suggested.

dialogue_turns.text: And the precipitation seems pretty normal too. Within average range for June and July.

dialogue_turns.text: It's a classic case of a scary-sounding rumor spreading faster than the boring, factual correction.
